Gloss: The ultimate user for which something is intended.
Building where medicine is practiced.
A scheduled meeting with a healthcare provider for consultation, treatment, or check-up.
The spatial property of a place where or way in which something is situated.
The route regularly followed by a passenger bus.
The route regularly followed by a passenger train.
A journey for some purpose (usually including the return).
A place on a bus route where buses stop to discharge and take on passengers.
A place on a train route where trains stop to discharge and take on passengers.
An ordered timetable outlining activities or operations for each day of the week.
An instance that does not conform to a schedule.
A symbol that establishes the identity of the one bearing it.
The name that precedes the surname.

Language Concept Word: surname, family name, cognomen, last name
Gloss: The name used to identify the members of a family (as distinguished from each member's given name).
A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.
A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su. Times are specified using 24:00 format. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00, 10am as 10:00.
A person who makes use of a thing; someone who uses or employs something.
Proper or appropriate position or location.
The specified day of the month.
An instance or single occasion for some event.
The place where a person or organization can be found or communicated with.
The angular distance between an imaginary line around a heavenly body parallel to its equator and the equator itself.
The angular distance between a point on any meridian and the prime meridian at Greenwich.
Identifies a route.

Indicates the type of transportation used on a route. Valid options are:

0 - Tram, Streetcar, Light rail. Any light rail or street level system within a metropolitan area.
1 - Subway, Metro. Any underground rail system within a metropolitan area.
2 - Rail. Used for intercity or long-distance travel.
3 - Bus. Used for short- and long-distance bus routes.
4 - Ferry. Used for short- and long-distance boat service.
5 - Cable tram. Used for street-level rail cars where the cable runs beneath the vehicle (e.g., cable car in San Francisco).
6 - Aerial lift, suspended cable car (e.g., gondola lift, aerial tramway). Cable transport where cabins, cars, gondolas or open chairs are suspended by means of one or more cables.
7 - Funicular. Any rail system designed for steep inclines.
11 - Trolleybus. Electric buses that draw power from overhead wires using poles.
12 - Monorail. Railway in which the track consists of a single rail or a beam.
Short name of a route. Often a short, abstract identifier (e.g., "32", "100X", "Green") that riders use to identify a route.
Full name of a route. This name is generally more descriptive than the route_short_name and often includes the route's destination or stop.
Identifies a trip.
Text that appears on signage identifying the trip's destination to riders.
The time at which a public conveyance is scheduled to arrive at a given destination.
The time at which a public conveyance is scheduled to depart from a given point of origin.
Identifies the serviced stop. A stop may be serviced multiple times in the same trip, and multiple trips and routes may service the same stop.
Name of the location. The stop_name should match the agency's rider-facing name for the location as printed on a timetable, published online, or represented on signage.
Latitude of the location.
Longitude of the location.
Start service day for the service interval.
End service day for the service interval. This service day is included in the interval.
An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.
A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
The specified day of the month.
Planned or scheduled for some certain time or times.
Confined or restricted to a particular location.
Make plans for something.

Language Concept Word: happen, hap, go on, pass off, occur, pass, fall out, come about, take place
Gloss: Come to pass.
Travel along a certain course.
Have as a part, be made up out of.
(superlative of `near' or `close') within the shortest distance.
Choose and follow; as of theories, ideas, policies, strategies or plans.
The act of nullifying; making null and void; counteracting or overriding the effect or force of something.
Give rise to; cause to happen or occur, not always intentionally.
Cause to be slowed down or delayed.
Cause to turn away from a previous or expected course.
